## DataView.getIterator() method

Gets the row iterator. The iterator is used to retrieve rows from the data view. The iterator can only be retrieved and consumed once per data view.

Using the iterator directly allows much more flexibility compared to the `getAllRows` helper function. It is possible to check if the dataView is valid and abort the fetch if needed. It is also possible to track progress since the total row count is known via the `getRowCount` method.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
getIterator(): DataViewRowIterator;
```
<b>Returns:</b>

`DataViewRowIterator`

## Example


```
let iterator = dataView.getIterator();
let rows = [];
let row = await iterator.next()
while(!row.done) {
    rows.push(row.value);
    row = await iterator.next()
}

```
